TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListView extends Urho.Gui.ScrollView

Docs.summary: Scrollable list UI element.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Gui.ListView which is tied to the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Gui.ListView, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Gui.ListView linked to a specific .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.

Docs.summary: Expand item at index. Only has effect in hierarchy mode.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance unsigned int32 FindItem(class Urho.Gui.UIElement item) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return index of item, or M_MAX_UNSIGNED If not found.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Gui.UIElement GetItem(unsigned int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return item at index.

Return whether hierarchy mode enabled. Or Enable hierarchy mode. Allows items to have parent-child relationship at different indent level and the ability to expand/collapse child items. All items in the list will be lost during mode change.
Return highlight mode. Or Set selected items' highlight mode.

MemberSignature.Value: public void InsertItem (uint index, Urho.Gui.UIElement item, Urho.Gui.UIElement parentItem = null);
.method public hidebysig instance void InsertItem(unsigned int32 index, class Urho.Gui.UIElement item, class Urho.Gui.UIElement parentItem) cil managed

Docs.summary: Insert item at a specific index. In hierarchy mode, the optional parameter will be used to determine the child's indent level in respect to its parent. If index is greater than the total items then the new item is inserted at the end of the list. In hierarchy mode, if index is greater than the index of last children of the specified parent item then the new item is inserted next to the last children. And if the index is lesser than the index of the parent item itself then the new item is inserted before the first child item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool IsExpanded(unsigned int32 index) cil managed

Docs.summary: Return whether an item at index has its children expanded (in hierachy mode only).

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

Docs.summary: Return whether reacts to click end instead of click start for item selection. Or Enable reacting to click end instead of click start for item selection. Default false.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToItemClicked(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.Gui.ItemClickedEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.ItemClicked += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the ItemClicked event raised by the ListView.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.
